title: Charles Stevens, 89; service today
content:
Dr. Charles Edgar Stevens, 89, of Greenville, died Friday, Sept. 4, 2015, at Cypress Glen Retirement Community in Greenville. He has family in Carteret County.  
  
His service is at 2:30 p.m. today in the Wilkerson Funeral Home chapel. Interment will follow at Oakdale Cemetery in Washington.  
      
He was born on Oct. 10, 1925, in Society Hill, S.C., to the late Rev. Charles Ezekiel Stevens and Mary Pearl Stevens. In 1952, he married Margaret “Peggy” Mann Swindell. 
 
Dr. Stevens was a lifelong educator, beginning in the Washington public schools system and ultimately retiring as dean of the ECU School of Music.  
 
He is survived by two daughters, Margaret Mauney of Winston-Salem and Mary Charles Jenkins of Morehead City; three grandchildren; a sister, Carolyn Crutchfield of Raleigh; and a brother, Raymond Stevens of Roswell, Ga.  
 
He was preceded in death by his wife, Peggy and a sister, Truett Whipple.  
 
The family will receive visitors for one hour prior to the service at Wilkerson Funeral Home. 
 
In lieu of flowers, memorial contributions can be made to the Charles E. and Margaret S. Stevens Endowment at East Carolina University, ECU Foundation, 2200 S. Charles Blvd., Greenville, N.C. 27858. 
 
Arrangements are by Wilkerson Funeral Home of Greenville. Online condolences may be made to the family at www.wilkersonfuneralhome.com .
